history.text: Hello have you seen The Blind Side
I have seen the movie
But it has been a few years
Yea it came out in 2009
Would you ever rewatch it?

I recall I liked it, but was surprised
 by the Rotten tomatoes score of 69
I have got bits and pieces of network TV
You?
I actually never seen it but I have heard of some of the big names in the cast

It was odd to see Tim McGraw as an actor.  I'm
 used to seeing him as a singer
Yes seen his name on the list and thought I knew it from music too
So did you like the plot of a woman taking in a foster child that becomes a football player?

Actually, Lily Collins who played Collins Tuohy
 is the daughter of Phil Collins.
It was uplifting and a little cheesy all at the same time but it was a good movie
I feel that most Sandra Bullock movies are cheesy at times
Totally agree!
The movie did show alot about high school football recruitment and what a huge business it is
I see it got a CinemaScore of A+ which is much better than the rotten tomatoes score
I agree that sports i just a business in the recruiters eyes
The scores/reviews are kind of all over.  I thought when it came out it was hailed by critics
It probably was a good movie to people who liked the idea of taking in a child, but not as good to people who wanted to see a hollywood made movie
Very true.  It may be one of those cases where the book was better!
Most book versions of stories like this are typically better.
Books are good for telling the story, while movies add the effects and visuals that are needed
The movie also just stopped after he was accepted to college.  They didn't really get into college or the NFL.  They did the summary about each character at the end
That seems like a common method when the movie budget is not big enough to finish it out
The paragraph in the document says he said farewell to the family.  They actually adopted him.  Odd wording
That is an odd  way to word that, kind of complicates it for no reason
